title-group.article-title: There Is Power in the School Nurse Recommendation to Immunize

contrib.aff: Nursing Education Director, NASN, Silver Spring, MD
Management Analyst, Dakota County Office of Planning & Analysis, Hastings, MN
Manager of Program Evaluation, Invitation Health Institute, Mounds View, MN

bio.p: Nichole Bobo joined the NASN staff in 2000 and has provided oversight for NASN immunization programming since that time. She currently serves as the project manager for the CDC-funded, 3-year cooperative agreement titled Improving Immunization Coverage: Clarifying Knowledge, Attitudes and Beliefs of School Nurses; work from this project provides the basis for this article. Nichole earned her BSN from Valparaiso University (Indiana) and MSN from the University of Akron (Ohio).

Jessie Carlson joined the Dakota County Office of Planning & Analysis in 2012 as a management analyst. Prior to joining Dakota County, Jessie worked as a senior public health program evaluator at Invitation Health Institute and as a grant and collaborative coordinator with Anoka County’s Children and Family Council. While at Invitation Health Institute, Jessie worked on the evaluation of the NASN 3-year cooperative agreement titled Improving Immunization Coverage: Clarifying Knowledge, Attitudes and Beliefs of School Nurses. Jessie earned a master’s degree in social work from the University of Minnesota–Duluth.

Sapna Swaroop guides the development and execution of evaluation and research for public health initiatives at Invitation Health Institute, including the NASN 3-year cooperative agreement titled Improving Immunization Coverage: Clarifying Knowledge, Attitudes and Beliefs of School Nurses. Prior to joining the Institute, she coordinated evaluation and research for the $47 million Statewide Health Improvement Program with the Minnesota Department of Health. She has held a variety of academic positions in sociology and demography. Dr. Swaroop received a BA in sociology from the University of Chicago and a PhD in sociology from the University of Michigan.
